description: Identify NEC code violations in a residential electrical panel

violations.description: Two conductors terminated under a single-pole breaker not rated for double-tapping
violations.hintText: Check breaker #3 — how many wires are connected to a single terminal?

violations.description: Open knockout hole without a cover plate exposing interior of panel
violations.hintText: Look at the bottom right of the panel — is every opening covered?

violations.description: 14 AWG wire connected to a 20A breaker — requires 12 AWG minimum per NEC Table 310.16
violations.hintText: Check the wire thickness on breaker #7 — does the gauge match the 20A rating?

violations.description: Panel directory is missing — all circuits must be identified with a legible label
violations.hintText: Is there a label on the panel door telling you what each breaker controls?
